comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Hermann Paasche ( February 24, 1851, Burg bei Magdeburg – April 11, 1925, Detroit) was a German statistician and economist. He is known for his Paasche Index, which provides a calculation of the Price Index. Paasche studied economics, agriculture, statistics and philosophy at University of Halle. In 1879, he became a professor of political science at Aachen University of Technology. Paasche died in 1925 in Detroit, Michigan, United States. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hermann_Paasche
